snippet: The Federal Administrative Court in Switzerland upheld the appeal of a bank client who had objected to his account data being turned over by Credit Suisse to the United States.
abstract: Federal Administrative Court in Switzerland upholds the appeal of a Credit Suisse client who had objected to his bank account data being turned over to the United States, a setback for efforts to end a tax dispute between the United States and Switzerland; says turning over account data would violate the terms of a 1996 tax treaty between the two countries.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Administrative Court in Switzerland upheld the appeal of a bank client who had objected to his account data being turned over by Credit Suisse to the United States.

headline.seo: Swiss Court Decision Snarls Effort to Reach U.S. Tax Deal
headline.main: Swiss Court Ruling Hampers a Tax Deal
headline.print_headline: Swiss Court Ruling Hampers a Tax Deal
